**CryoEngines 2.0.1**

- Updated Russian translation by r4ndom
- Adjusted some engine core effects to look better
- Zeroed Harrier thrust transforms
- Updated Waterfall configurations to use new features from Waterfall 0.6.0 (thanks Zorg!)
- Updated <abbr title="Liquid Fuel and Oxidizer"><abbr title="Liquid Fuel and Oxidizer">LFO</abbr></abbr> extras patch to handle methalox engines
- Added new CryoEngines NFLV patch
    - Converts Cougar, Lynx to use LH2/<abbr title="Liquid Fuel"><abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr></abbr>/O and LH2/O when installed

I guess so. Sorry, but I can't stand "mesh plumes". Rocket engines do not eject 3D plumes that look good only from certain angles (and look much worse if you look from where you weren't supposed to look. I can give you screenshots, if you don't believe me)

> 
> 
> 59 minutes ago, biohazard15 said:
> 
> 
> I guess so. Sorry, but I can't stand "mesh plumes". Rocket engines do not eject 3D plumes that look good only from certain angles (and look much worse if you look from where you weren't supposed to look. I can give you screenshots, if you don't believe me)
> 

This may not come as a surprise but I fundamentally disagree! Rocket engines don't eject discrete billboarded meshes that only look good from certain angles and positions. Assuredly, we live in a world which in which many opinions are valid and there may be more than one answer to a problem. However that is no call to go around being uh, distinctly impolite about people's hard work.

If you seriously want to have a productive discussion, you can go to the Waterfall thread and post your complaints and damnning screenshots there. Then we can work to address the issues, instead of complaining in people's threads.

**Edited <time datetime="2021-03-13T01:08:05Z" title="03/13/2021 01:08  AM" data-short="3 yr">March 13, 2021</time> by Nertea**

How do I get the correct ratio of methane to oxidizer for the methalox engines?  There doesn't seem to be a preset in Configurable Containers.  Do I just need to manually add resources to the tank at the correct ratio?  If so, what would that ratio be?

> 
> 
> 8 hours ago, EnfieldOneOne said:
> 
> 
> Configurable Containers.
> 

You need CryoTanks.

Does using RealFuels disable the cooling option (using EC) in cryogenic tanks? Because while cooling seems to be available for my Interstellar tanks, they don't seem to appear as an option for the cryo tanks...

> 
> 
> 21 hours ago, Angel33Demon said:
> 
> 
> Does using RealFuels disable the cooling option (using EC) in cryogenic tanks? Because while cooling seems to be available for my Interstellar tanks, they don't seem to appear as an option for the cryo tanks...
> 

Yes, the assumption is that if you are using Interstellar or RealFuels, you prefer those mechanics and CryoTanks won't really do anything.

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, Nertea said:
> 
> 
> Yes, the assumption is that if you are using Interstellar or RealFuels, you prefer those mechanics and CryoTanks won't really do anything.
> 

Yes, but shouldn't the CryoTanks still exhibit the same behavior as the cryogenic tanks from Interstellar in this case? Given that they're both meant to take some EC and use it for cooling, I think it's weird that this disables that option for CryoTanks when both are installed...

> 
> 
> 8 hours ago, Angel33Demon said:
> 
> 
> Yes, but shouldn't the CryoTanks still exhibit the same behavior as the cryogenic tanks from Interstellar in this case? Given that they're both meant to take some EC and use it for cooling, I think it's weird that this disables that option for CryoTanks when both are installed...
> 

IFS takes precedence to avoid the mods interfering with each other.

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, Angel33Demon said:
> 
> 
> Yes, but shouldn't the CryoTanks still exhibit the same behavior as the cryogenic tanks from Interstellar in this case? Given that they're both meant to take some EC and use it for cooling, I think it's weird that this disables that option for CryoTanks when both are installed...
> 

The overall issue is that when you start installing multiple fuel switch mods, I don't know what feature sets you want, and what gameplay paradigms you want. I also don't want to know and handle every permutation. Is IFS using the same power usage/fuel? The same mass ratio? It's unlikely. This is going to cause functional and balance inconsistencies, so I just turn the patches off if I detect that a tank has been touched by some other mod.
